subject: Re: [junit] junit testing
msgSnippet: Have you read the Junit getting started stuff at http://junit.sourceforge.net/ ?  That will explain how to write a Junit Test. But basically
messageBody:
Have you read the Junit getting started stuff at
http://junit.sourceforge.net/ <http://junit.org>? That will explain how to
write a Junit Test.

But basically you wish to test the behaviour of the createpartcontrol method
... in that it either returns something or changes some state somewhere.
Using JUnit assert statements you will assert that the behaviour you expect
is indeed what happens.

Bill Wake coined the three A's Arrange, Act, Assert which sums up a test
.... in your case you need to Arrange some objects ... the object that
createpartcontrol is called on and a composite object, the Act is the call
to createpartcontrol and then write an Assert to check that is behaved as
expected.


Hope that helps,
Shane


On 8/16/06, eclipse.junit < eclipse.junit@...> wrote:
>
> hi all,
> Im new to Junit testing, im Using eclipse to write my tests.
>
> i have a method createpartcontrol(composite).
> i dont know how do i test this. and in my test how do i create a
> composite.
> any idea?
>
>
>



--
Shane Mingins
